# Data process



## Australia


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `RETIRED`|`WHATYEAR`|`ybirth`|
|-|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `Are you retired from your last job?`|`In what year did you retire?`|`Year of birth`|
| **Table name**  | `ALSA-Wave1` |`ALSA-Wave1` |`ybirth`|
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes`<br/>`2 = No` |`continuous`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** | `9`<br/>`NA` |`9999`<br/>`NA`|  |
| **Description** |  |  |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ALSA_w1','ALSA.ALSA-Wave1',variables=list('RETIRED','WHATYEAR'), missings = T)
ALSA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'ALSA_w1')
load(paste0(datafolder,"w1/ybirth.RData"))
ALSA_w1$ybirth <- ybirth$ybirth
rm(ybirth)

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ALSA_w1$RETIRED
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(9))[3], caption = 'RETIRED')
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(9))[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ALSA_w1, aes(x=factor(RETIRED))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = c(9999))[3], caption = 'WHATYEAR')
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(9999))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(filter(ALSA_w1,vbl!=9999), aes(WHATYEAR)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue" ) + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ALSA_w1$ybirth
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = 'ybirth')
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(ALSA_w1, aes(ybirth)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(1885,1930)

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 2 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `9, NA into 999`

To compute `age_retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `WHATYEAR == 9999 or NA into 999`
* `otherwise, age_retired = WHATYEAR - ybirth`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

ALSA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ALSA_w1$id)
ALSA_ds_w1$retired <- car::recode(ALSA_w1$RETIRED, "2 = 0; c(9,NA) = 999")

ALSA_ds_w1$age_retired <- rep(999,length(ALSA_w1$id))
ALSA_ds_w1$age_retired[which(!is.na(ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR) & ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR != 9999)] <- ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR[which(!is.na(ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR) & ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR != 9999)] - ALSA_w1$ybirth[which(!is.na(ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR) & ALSA_w1$WHATYEAR != 9999)]

# Global table
ALSA_ds <- ALSA_ds_w1

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ALSA_ds_w1$retired
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ALSA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(retired))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ALSA_ds_w1$age_retired
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(filter(ALSA_ds_w1,!vbl %in% miss_values_vector), aes(age_retired)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(ALSA_ds_w1$retired)
X <- table(ALSA_w1$RETIRED,useNA = "ifany")
BeforeH <- c(X[2:1],sum(X[3:4]))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("2->0","1->1","9,NA->999")
kable(C)

```

```{r harmo w2}

ALSA_w2 <- left_join(ALSA_w2,ALSA_ds, by="id")

ALSA_ds_w2$retired <- car::recode(ALSA_w2$retired, "c(0,NA)=999")
ALSA_ds_w2$age_retired <- car::recode(ALSA_w2$age_retired, "NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

### Wave 3


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `CURRWKW3`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `CURRENTLY WORKING`|
| **Table name**  | `ALSA-Wave3` |
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes`<br/>`2 = No` |
| **Missings** | `9`<br/>`NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign w3, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ALSA_w3','ALSA.ALSA-Wave3',variables=list('CURRWKW3'), missings = T)
ALSA_w3 <- opal.execute(o,'ALSA_w3')

```

```{r local w3, echo=F}

vbl <- ALSA_w3$CURRWKW3
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(9))[3], caption = names(ALSA_w3)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(9))[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ALSA_w3, aes(x=factor(CURRWKW3))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `retired w1 != 1 and CURRWKW3 == 1 into 0`
* `retired w1 == 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `age_retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `age_retired = age_retired from w1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w3}

ALSA_w3 <- left_join(ALSA_w3,ALSA_ds, by="id")

ALSA_ds_w3 <- tibble(id=ALSA_w3$id)
ALSA_ds_w3$retired <- rep(999,length(ALSA_w3$id))
ALSA_ds_w3$retired[which(ALSA_w3$retired==1)] <- 1
ALSA_ds_w3$retired[which((ALSA_w3$retired!=1 | is.na(ALSA_w3$retired)) & ALSA_w3$CURRWKW3==1)] <- 0
ALSA_ds_w3$age_retired <- car::recode(ALSA_w3$age_retired, "NA=999")

# Update of global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
ALSA_ds_prov <- ALSA_ds[,c(1,2)]
ALSA_ds_prov <- assign_merge(ALSA_ds_prov,ALSA_ds_w3,log_vec=(ALSA_ds_prov$id %in% ALSA_ds_w3$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
ALSA_ds$retired <- ALSA_ds_prov$retired
rm(ALSA_ds_prov)

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w3, echo=F}

vbl <- ALSA_ds_w3$retired
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ALSA_ds_w3, aes(x=factor(retired))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ALSA_ds_w3$age_retired
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(filter(ALSA_ds_w3,!vbl %in% miss_values_vector), aes(age_retired)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w3, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(ALSA_ds_w3$retired)
X <- c(
  sum((ALSA_w3$retired!=1 | is.na(ALSA_w3$retired)) & ALSA_w3$CURRWKW3==1,na.rm = T),
  sum(ALSA_w3$retired==1,na.rm = T)
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(ALSA_w3$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("CURRWKW3->0","retired->1","otherwise->999")
kable(C)

```

```{r assign w6, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ALSA_w6','ALSA.ALSA-Wave6',variables=list('CURRWKW6'), missings = T)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `retired previously != 1 and CURRWKW6 == 1 into 0`
* `retired previously != 1 and CURRWKW6 == 0 into 995`
* `retired previously == 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `age_retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `age_retired = age_retired from w1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w6}

ALSA_w6 <- left_join(ALSA_w6,ALSA_ds, by="id")

  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]

  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
ALSA_ds_prov <- ALSA_ds[,c(1,2)]
ALSA_ds_prov <- assign_merge(ALSA_ds_prov,ALSA_ds_w6,log_vec=(ALSA_ds_prov$id %in% ALSA_ds_w6$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
ALSA_ds$retired <- ALSA_ds_prov$retired
```

```{r local w7, echo=F}
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(0))[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ALSA_w7, aes(x=factor(currwkw7))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `retired previously != 1 and currwkw7 == 1 into 0`
* `retired previously != 1 and currwkw7 == 0 into 995`
* `retired previously == 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `age_retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `age_retired = age_retired from w1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w7}

ALSA_w7 <- left_join(ALSA_w7,ALSA_ds, by="id")

ALSA_ds_w7 <- tibble(id=ALSA_w7$id)
ALSA_ds_w7$retired <- rep(999,length(ALSA_w7$id))
ALSA_ds_w7$retired[which(ALSA_w7$retired==1)] <- 1
ALSA_ds_w7$retired[which((ALSA_w7$retired!=1 | is.na(ALSA_w7$retired)) & ALSA_w7$currwkw7==1)] <- 0
ALSA_ds_w7$retired[which((ALSA_w7$retired!=1 | is.na(ALSA_w7$retired)) & ALSA_w7$currwkw7==0)] <- 995
ALSA_ds_w7$age_retired <- car::recode(ALSA_w7$age_retired, "NA=999")

# Update of global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
```

| **Table name**  | `ALSA-Wave11` |
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes`<br/>`0 = No` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign w11, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ALSA_w11','ALSA.ALSA-Wave11',variables=list('CURRWKW11'), missings = T)
ALSA_w11 <- opal.execute(o,'ALSA_w11')

```

```{r local w11, echo=F}

vbl <- ALSA_w11$CURRWKW11
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ALSA_w11)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ALSA_w11, aes(x=factor(CURRWKW11))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `retired previously != 1 and CURRWKW11 == 1 into 0`
* `retired previously == 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `age_retired` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `age_retired = age_retired from w1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w11}

ALSA_w11 <- left_join(ALSA_w11,ALSA_ds, by="id")

ALSA_ds_w11 <- tibble(id=ALSA_w11$id)
ALSA_ds_w11$retired <- rep(999,length(ALSA_w11$id))
ALSA_ds_w11$retired[which(ALSA_w11$retired==1)] <- 1
ALSA_ds_w11$retired[which((ALSA_w11$retired!=1 | is.na(ALSA_w11$retired)) & ALSA_w11$CURRWKW11==1)] <- 0
ALSA_ds_w11$age_retired <- car::recode(ALSA_w11$age_retired, "NA=999")

# Update of global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
ALSA_ds_prov <- ALSA_ds[,c(1,2)]
ALSA_ds_prov <- assign_merge(ALSA_ds_prov,ALSA_ds_w11,log_vec=(ALSA_ds_prov$id %in% ALSA_ds_w11$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
ALSA_ds$retired <- ALSA_ds_prov$retired
rm(ALSA_ds_prov)

```

<!--AUXILIAR FUNCTIONS-->



```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab = ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- labelled(aux_object[[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label[1:(length(cat_label)-9)])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


labelling_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab=ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with continuous data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- m.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cont_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- remove_val_labels(aux_object[[vbl_name]])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[2+length(cat_label),] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Creation of summary tables for continuous data

summaries_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of column with summary table categories
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[1:6]
  # Adding of missing/no-missing values categories
  t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[vbl_name]], missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    # First, summary values
    t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[1:6]
    # Next, missing/no-missing values (the 1 in $values_table[1,] stands for absolute values, while a 2 would stand for percentages)
    t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[vbl_name]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))
  # Add wave/population names
  dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name]))[[2]],lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}



# Creation of trajectories table for each population

trajectories <- function(m.hds,vbl_name){
  
  # First wave data
  dbb <- m.hds[[1]][,c("id",vbl_name)]
  # Merge with next waves data
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    dbb <- merge(dbb, m.hds[[ind]][,c("id",vbl_name)], by = "id", suffixes = c("", paste0(".",names(m.hds)[ind])), all = T)
  }
  names(dbb) <- c("id", names(m.hds))
  
  # Glue individual data through all waves into trajectories
  v.dbb <- dbb[,2]
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    v.dbb <- paste(v.dbb,dbb[,ind+1],sep="")
  }
  # Trajectories and frequencies
  f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
  return(f.dbb)
  
}

# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }
  
}

```

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable `retired` accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

```{r summ, echo=F}


# Consider only harmonised waves
l.hds <- lapply(alsa.cw, function(wname) if(hd_vbl %in% names(get0(paste0("ALSA_ds_",wname[1])))){wname})

nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}



if(length(l.hds)>0){
  lmlist[[1]] <- alsalist[[1]][sapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]])]
  lmlist[[2]] <- alsalist[[2]][sapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]])]
  
  # Printing table of categories
  print(knitr::kable(summaries(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[2]]),hd_vbl),caption=ds_label))
  # Printing table of trajectories
  f.dbb <- trajectories(lmlist[[2]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
  print(knitr::kable(f.dbb))

}



```
